fields.description:
JIRA issue keys are not being rendered as links in the Activity Stream gadget in JIRA.
They are however being linked in the Fisheye Recent Changesets gadget, so I presume it's not something to do with the Application Link configuration.
fields.summary: Fisheye activity stream in JIRA not linking to issues
Source tab stop working when pausing one of multiple FishEye repositories

fields.description:
We have created some projects in Fisheye that not all users can read. When we commit messages on their issues, they see this error:

This list of changesets may be incomplete, as errors occurred retrieving changesets from the following repositories: • Repository Ops on http://fisheye.corp.pinger.com/ failed: Error in remote call to 'fisheye' (http://fisheye/) [AbstractRestCommand{path='/rest-service-fe/changeset-v1/listChangesets/', params={expand=changesets[-21:-1].revisions[0:29], comment=TAG-1211, p4JobFixed=TAG-1211, rep=Tag}, methodType=GET}] : Received status code 403 (Forbidden)

While it is good that they can't see these commits, it is a fairly thing for the user to see. Please revise so that the user either sees a friendly message saying they don't have access, or better yet don't show this at all.
fields.summary: User should not see errors for a Fisheye project they have no rights for.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13902].
  {panel}

An OnDemand instance with no Fisheye or Crucible links has the following behaviour:
*Current:*
* Add a comment to an issue with wiki-style renderer
* Include the text {noformat}r42{noformat}
* Preview or Add comment
* The 'r42' text will not be displayed

*Expected:*
* Without a trusted authentication link between JIRA and Fisheye the test is rendered as 'r42' without any hyperlink

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+to+Create+a+FishEye's+Changeset+or+Crucible's+Review+Link+on+JIRA's+Comment+or+Description
fields.summary: Comments obfuscated when renderer attempts to create Fe/Cru link without an application link to Fisheye/Crucible

fields.description:
h3.Problem

In Fisheye, a commit can be related to a directory, then no new files exist. In this case the revision is not possible

In this situation, when merging commits that result in 0 files is not possible to execute the "Resolve Issue" transition, when it requeries "no open Crucible reviews" and "no unreviewed changesets". 

Example:
* X working on ABC-1, merging ABC-2 branch in.
{quote}
    X submitted changeset 79c72334d61ce2063b87f7cdda1850cd02215289 to ABC-1 in ABC (0 file) - 21/Feb/12 3:32 PM

    Merge branch 'ABC-2'
{quote}

h3.Fix

There is none yet.

h3.Workaround
There is none yet.
fields.summary: Bad handling of workflow condition for unreviewed changesets

fields.description:
I've created several repositories in fisheye, and deleted some of them.
However, deleted repositories are shows in Jira>Fisheye Configuration.
Furthermore pages in project shows following messages.

I've tried delete fisheye revision cache and refresh repository list (at Jira>Fisheye Configuration>Fisheye).
What should I do to sync repository list?


This list of changesets may be incomplete, as errors occurred retrieving changesets from the following repositories:
{code}
Repository XSISBusSimulator on http://192.168.3.33:8060/ failed: Error in remote call to 'FishEye 0 (http://192.168.3.33:8060/)' (http://192.168.3.33:8060/) [AbstractRestCommand{path='api/rest/query', params={query=select revisions from dir / where comment matches 'XSIS-49' order by date group by changeset return csid, rep=XSISBusSimulator}, methodType=POST}] : unknown repository: XSISBusSimulator
Repository XSIS-SSRU-Control on http://192.168.3.33:8060/ failed: Error in remote call to 'FishEye 0 (http://192.168.3.33:8060/)' (http://192.168.3.33:8060/) [AbstractRestCommand{path='api/rest/query', params={query=select revisions from dir / where comment matches 'XSIS-49' order by date group by changeset return csid, rep=XSIS-SSRU-Control}, methodType=POST}] : unknown repository: XSIS-SSRU-Control
{code}
fields.summary: Deleted Fisheye Repositories remain showing in Jira

fields.description:
The Perforce Job Integration configurations do not remain visible in the UI when JIRA is restarted.  The user must manually re-enter the values after a restart for the Perforce integration to operate.

The configurations don't seem to be actually disappearing after the restart as they persist in the database. The issue seems to be in the UI. Rather than recognizing that configurations exist for Perforce Job Integrations, the system acts as if nothing is there.
fields.summary: Perforce Job Integration configurations disappear after restart

fields.description:
h4. Steps to repro:

1. Setup JIRA and FeCru and applink the two of them
2. Create an issue, and a review.
3. Put a No open reviews condition in the workflow.
4. Put the issue key in the objectives portion of the review.

h4. Expected
You can transition the issue since this field in Crucible has nothing to do with the Development Panel and since the Crucible data isn't reflected in JIRA it should not have an effect on the workflow.

h4. Actual
The transition is not available.
fields.summary: No open reviews condition incorrectly checks Crucible's "Objectives" field for issue key

fields.description:
If there's no source repository of any sort hooked up to a JIRA OnDemand instance, clicking the Source tab shows this:

!source.png!

The Configure button for the Bitbucket section is out of date and goes to https://<hostname>/secure/admin/ConfigureBitbucketOAuth!default.jspa which is a 404. It should be https://<hostname>/secure/admin/ConfigureDvcsOrganizations!default.jspa.
fields.summary: "Configure" link for Bitbucket in Source tab in JIRA OnDemand goes to non-existent URL

fields.description:
The separation of Commits vs Source tag is causing a lot of confusion, as seen at https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/201627/commits-vs-source-tab and https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/196250/jira-6-what-s-the-differences-between-commits-and-source-tabs

Consider merging the two tabs into one.
fields.summary: Consider merging Commits and Source tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating an unproxied applink and changing the Base URL and Display URL to the proxied URL after creation, commits in the other application will take a long time to be updated in JIRA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Refer to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/How+to+create+an+unproxied+application+link] and create an unproxied application link
# After the link is created using ipaddress in the Application URL, change the Base URL and Display URL to the proxied URL

h3. Expected Results
# All commits in the other application will show up within a few minutes in JIRA

h3. Actual Results
It takes a long time for JIRA to be updated about the commits

h3.Workaround
# No known workaround. Create the applinks using the proxied URL
fields.summary: Commits in FeCru/Stash takes a long time to be updated in JIRA when Display URL and Application URL is different

fields.description:
running JIRA : v6.0.6#6105-sha1:9713ad1
running Crucible : Version:2.7.11 Build:20120227023831 2012-02-27

An issue is created under a project ABC. Work is done on ABC-1222 for 2 months. Source tab tracks Subversion changes indexed by Crucible.
Mid-way project XYZ is created. ABC-1222 is converted to XYZ-88. Source tab now shows history committed when issue was ABC-1222, however the issues list is no longer sorted. (previously sorted descending by date/time)

We checked other ABC-#### issues that had not converted or previously closed, the sorting is correct (descending). (This also resolved that the crucible dB may need re-index)
fields.summary: Jira issue source tab items are unsorted when issue is renamed to a new project

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+ # enable Perforce Job Integration in JIRA # create a multi-line text field in JIRA # create a Job Checkbox custom field (in JIRA) for Perforce # put these fields on Create Issue screen # follow [this|http://www.perforce.com/perforce/doc.current/manuals/p4sag/chapter.jobspecs.html] to add a new field to Perforce jobs # edit Perforce Job Integration -> Map Custom Fields and map the multi-line text field (step 2) to the Perforce field (step 5) # create a new JIRA issue and tick Yes at the Job Checkbox field (step 3) to have it duplicated as a Perforce job # also enter several lines into the multi-line text field e.g.: {code} FirstLine SecondLine ThirdLine {code} # click Create h4. +Expected behavior+ The JIRA issue is duplicated as a Perforce job with the correct field mappings h4. +Actual behavior+ A Perforce job is not created because of this error in JIRA log: {code} 2015-03-12 21:58:29,401 http-bio-2768-exec-18 ERROR admin 1318x2636x1 jku0d9 192.168.1.100,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [com.perforce.api.Debug] P4 exited with an Error! 2015-03-12 21:58:29,402 http-bio-2768-exec-18 ERROR admin 1318x2636x1 jku0d9 192.168.1.100,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [jirafisheyeplugin.perforce.listener.JobUpdateListener] Could not commit job: Job: DEMO-17 User: admin Description: Test com.perforce.api.CommitException at com.perforce.api.Job.commit(Job.java:365) at com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin.perforce.listener.JobUpdateListener.createJob(JobUpdateListener.java:42) at com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin.perforce.listener.JobUpdateListener.workflowEvent(JobUpdateListener.java:30) ... Caused by: java.io.IOException: error: Error in job specification.error: Error detected at line 11.error: Syntax error in 'SecondLine'. at com.perforce.api.P4Process.closeProcess(P4Process.java:587) at com.perforce.api.Job.commit(Job.java:361) ... 226 more {code} h4. +Note+ * If only 1 line is entered into the text field, a Perforce job is created successfully * In Perforce, multiple lines can be manually entered into the same field * It doesn't matter whether the multi-line text field in JIRA uses Default Text or Wiki Style renderer h4. +Workaround+ Using HTML tag {{
}} to indicate new lines works. For example, using this single line in the multi-line text field: {code}FirstLine
SecondLine
ThirdLine{code} * It appears as a single line, thus it works * In Perforce, the field is rendered correctly with separate lines
fields.summary: Syntax error when mapping multi-line text field from JIRA to Perforce

fields.description:
If a non-admin user clicks the "Hide this tab" link on a FishEye/Crucible ad, it attempts to navigate to websudo screens, prompting the non-admin to enter the password to perform an administrative action.

For more details please look at Fisheye issue FISH-569 (https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/FISH-569)

Video clipping can be found here -> http://screencast.com/t/pnqJeG7jxr
fields.summary: Non-Admin users cannot hide the SOURCE and REVIEW tabs in a JIRA issue

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, there is no feature to configure Create Branch menu to be available for certain project

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to configure "Create Branch" option to be available for certain project
fields.summary: Having the option to configure "Create Branch" option to be available for certain project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Venezuela recently switched their timezone offset from GMT-4:30 to GMT-4. JIRA will need to have the timezone updated to use the new offset.

{quote}
Venezuela uses the UTC−04:00 time offset, and they had previously used UTC−04:30 from December 9, 2007 until April 30, 2016.
{quote}

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_in_Venezuela

h3. Environment 
*  Effects Cloud - version 1000.110.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set JIRA User profile to use Caracas time zone

h3. Expected Results

* Timezone off-set should be GMT-04:00

h3. Actual Results

* Timezone off-set is set to GMT-04:30
 
h3.Workaround
Select another timezone that's currently in GMT-04:00 such as Antigua
fields.summary: Timezone in JIRA for Venezuela Needs to be Updated

fields.description:
*Background*
I have a Scrum Board, and a Kanban Board.

I use the Kanban Board for Business Features, to separate stakeholders from feeling like editing tasks.  We use Epics in this view, one per business feature.

The engineering team pulls these into their own Scrum Board by creating a new epic on their board with the same name and linking to the Kanban epic for visibility.  The team is empowered to pull off the kanban as they wish, and create their own tasks.

For visibility, we want the Kanban Epics linked to the Scrum Epics. 

The workflow is a bit cumbersome

*Problem*
 It is a huge pain to manually link (click the epic in Scrum Board, click More, click Link, etc...  too many steps, and the server response is slow between each).

Also, when under Link, it is unreliable, I start typing my epic title, and it doesn't show, I have to type the ID for the epic most of the time (PRO-24).  This is a huge pain. 

*Solution*
It would be nice to drag an epic from one board to another board's epic, to create the link (or right click link, then drag to the other browser window's epic to link it...)....   

An alternative that would work for us would be ability to auto mirror kanban epics upon creation to a Scrum Board.  I also looked for Bulk Copy but it didn't seem to exist.

Another alternative would be a kanban view for Epic viewing / editing, in the individual Scrum Board.  Then we could eliminate a level.  Though it is nice to have multiple teams (and multiple Scrum Boards) all linking to the same Kanban, so....  Not sure this is a flexible solution (perhaps it's a separate nice-to-have independent of this request).
fields.summary: Fast drag & drop linking from issue in one project to issue in another project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the _Keep me logged in_ box is checked, after restarting the browser jira goes trough the process of authentication again and loses the initial request. 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to the Cloud instance
# Go to JIRA
# Create a bookmark of something different than the dashboard. 
# Quit the browser 
# Reopen the browser
# Access the bookmark 

h3. Expected Results

The initial request page should be loaded. 

h3. Actual Results
Jira goes trough the authentication process and ends up loading the dashboard. 


h3.Workaround
Click on the bookmark twice,
OR
Don't use the keep me logged in check-box.
fields.summary: After the browser is restarted, Jira loads the Dashboard first, even if another jira path is requested

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

User would like to differentiate an issue priority by inserting an image as a background in each card in Active Sprint view to make it easier.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to insert an image as background in each card.
fields.summary: A feature to insert background image in each card in Active Sprint View

fields.description: Ability to estimate at sprint or release level rather than at stories' level.
fields.summary: Ability to estimate at sprint or release level

fields.description:
Dear Concern,
It will be great help if you can address the following issues for me.
1) Story point is present on the issue but it not displaying on the Sprint Report. See attachments TabletSprint_Report1 & TabletSprint1 for reference.
2) On Sprint Report wrong Story Point is displaying. See attachments TabletSprint_Report2 & TabletSprint2 for your reference.
3) In the extract file many issues are not having Original estimate or Work log where as if you see the actual issue, it has the both. E.g. See ONE-1446 in the internal JIRA & the attached excel.
Look forward for your support on the above.
fields.summary: Facing some anomaly on Reports & Extracts

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

User would like JIRA to have "Clone" button in Version page. They need an ability to Bulk clone Versions along with the issues in the versions in JIRA.

*Where to have the option to clone versions.*

Navigate to a project Administration tab -> Click Versions -> on Top right before merge requesting a tab that says clone (Screenshot Attached).

This Bulk clone should provide options to bulk clone issues, subtasks, Attachments, Watchers, comments from one version to another version.

The user should be given permission to select what items need to be cloned from an issue. (Right from customfields to subtasks, Attachments, Watchers, comments)

*Suggested Solution*

Add the "Clone" button is the Version page which is located in Project Administration page.

*Workaround*

For now if user would like to Clone issue, they can do so from the Issue page itself. To clone issue please refer to [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/cloning-an-issue-720416353.html] documentation.
fields.summary: Add "Clone" button in Version page.
x-sell logo is showing JIRA when it should be confluence

fields.description: Sorry if I've opened this in the wrong project.
fields.summary: Image and text bug

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be extremely useful if it was possible to assign dates in the scrum board columns.

# We already configure the sprint end date, so that could be displayed in the last column.\\
\\
So, in our case, currently the last column is named "Done".
What we'd like to see is "Done (by 08/Jul/16)"\\
\\
Although this information is 1 click away, so it wouldn't be that big of an improvement (though easy to implement). But it makes sense if #2 below is implemented too.\\
\\
# What would be important in our case is the one-to-last column, which is "Test Done".\\
\\
That would become "Test Done (by 01/Jul/16)".\\
\\
What would be probably the correct/concise way, is a configuration on a board level, of an X amount of days before the sprint end date, for any column; which, if set, will be displayed as per my examples (or similar).

The last sentence of #2 is my recommendation / feature request...

Thanks for a great product :) \\
\\
----
\\
original post: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39228431/answers/39228618
fields.summary: scrum board column deadline
This use for Bus reports
JIRA Software does not respect opsbar-sequence property on transitions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The top header menu of JIRA disappears when the user go to search issues page and try to scroll down or click on comment, and does not turn back to normal until you go back to home page.

Affected version: 1000.98.4 - Not appearing as a version at the moment on Cloud options

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the top menu and click *Issues* > *Search for issues*.
# Click on *comment* in any issue.

h3. Expected Results
The comment box open with no alteration on the top menu header.

h3. Actual Results
The comment box open and the top menu header disappears.

h3.Workaround
Opening the issue in the project and click on comment from there.
fields.summary: JIRA header menu disappear when the users scrolls down or click on comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13862].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In JIRA Software, customers would like the Breadcrumbs to navigate back to where they came from.  

For example, when navigating to an Issue Details page from the Board
# Click on Issue Card
# Click on Issue ID in Right Sidebar to view issue

Once in the Issue Details view, clicking on the Project's Name in the Breadcrumb does not navigate back to the Board but instead to the Project's All Open Issues Page

h3. Suggested Solution
The breadcrumb navigation takes the user Back to the previous view they navigated from

h3.Workaround
- Use the Keyboard Shortcut *g + a* or *g + h* to go back to the Board
or 
- Click on the Backlog/Active Sprint option in the Sidebar
fields.summary: Link the Project Name Breadcrumb to Previous View

fields.description:
We're having a situation where tickets are in a particular status for too long and its not easy to see that they've been there for too long just by looking at the agile board.

If possible, we'd like for the tickets to indicate that they've been there for a certain number of hours. My idea is to have them change colors from no color to yellow to red.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Change color of tickets in swimlanes when they are in one status for too long

fields.description: Is it possible to set a default color for newly created epics' labels? So that new epics are created with the same color or no label color at all. This being an alternative to newly created epics having randomly assigned label colors.
fields.summary: Default epic label colors

fields.description:
I was at a customer meeting and feedback from their usage was that it would be incredible easy if there were a standard "Epics" quick filter on top of the Agile Boards, which would tie in the feature, that would change the swimlanes to "Epics" as well so that its easier to view and manage Epics.

Does this sound like a good feature?
fields.summary: Agile Boards to have a standard "Epics" -quick filter that automatically changes swimlanes to "Epics"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment when you are in Active Sprints view and select Board > Print cards, the issues in your swimlanes wont be displayed in the generated issue card.


h3. Suggested Solution
Include the issues displayed in swimlanes to the issue card when using Print cards in the Active Sprints view.


h3. Workaround
Change the swimlanes settings to not show swimlanes and print a new issue card.
You can do it in Board > Configure > Swimlanes.
fields.summary: Include the story swimlane (headers) when printing issue cards

fields.description:
h2. problem definition

At the moment, Epic links enable only a single ticket to be selected.

h2. suggested solution
Provide the ability to add more than one Epic to the Story issue.
fields.summary: Abilty to link more than one Epic to the same Story
Wrong sintax of quick filter
Cannot delete/update quick filter w/ JQL single quotes

fields.description: Creating a customfield using the fieldType com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea we included the value teratext@www.fred.com.au The generated HTML output in the JIRA screen is as follows: {html} www.fred.com'>teratext@www.fred.com {html} To output is a mix of a hyperlink to a mailto as well as a web URL and its a fail. !fredcom.png|thumbnail! instead of a url of mailto:teratext@www.fred.com it tries to include a url to the email address and a hyperlink to the www.fred.com address. The HTML output is incorrect. Prefer that JIRA does not try and and create 2 html anchors instead just create {html} teratext@www.fred.com {html}
fields.summary: URI gets misinterpreted in our customfield

fields.description:
Hello,

My development team uses JIRA extensively, day in and day out - so no issue with paying license fees for those users.  However, we do interact with the rest of our organization and occasionally need them to comment on a bug/story or otherwise provide a small amount of input.  The input is vital, but not enough to really upgrade our jira license - especially being a small non-profit - going up a level is quite costly.

Opening up our jira instance for anonymous content isn't really viable either as our tickets include sensitive information.

What I'd like to see is the ability to add "free" users who can only view, comment, maybe do a few other minimal tasks - without having to open it up to all anon users.
fields.summary: Allow creation of free viewer accounts

fields.description:
We require the IDs of the Story and Epic issue types for the reliable operation of our JIRA Software Cloud Add-on. Currently the only way to obtain them is to scan /rest/api/2/issuetype and try to find them by name or description. However all of the fields in each of these issue type objects are user editable and therefore unreliable.

To save us this heartache, it'd be _amazing_ if we could obtain the IDs of the Story and Epic issue types in the JIRA Software Board api. i.e. /rest/agile/board/boardId/configuration

Thanks!
fields.summary: Please expose the Story and Epic issue types in the Board configuration API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some JIRA administrators want the ability to hide some menu items that is not necessary to a subset of users. For example the Report.
 !image-2016-06-21-09-57-07-642.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to hide menu items to a group of users

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Hide Agile menu items from a subset of users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13838].
  {panel}

We make extensive use of quick filters for our team board. Today, I tried doing two operations on quick filters, both which failed: a) reorder b) delete

When trying to do both, I see the following errors in the developer console client-side:
POST https://redfin.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/quickfilters/57/776/move 400 (Bad Request)
DELETE https://redfin.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/quickfilters/57/397?undefined 400 (Bad Request)

 !image-2016-06-20-13-45-47-306.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot reorder or delete quick filter
Can't delete or edit Quick Filters w/ Failing JQL

fields.description:
I'd like to be able configure jira to prevent a specific workflow transition only in JIRA board, but still enable it using actions on issue.

The reason is that when I drag the issue, the small space where I can drop the issue onto next column has 2 options, and users might drop over the other one by mistake. (image attached)

For reference, the issue origin state is "To Test", and possible destination transitions are "Certified" and "Close" (Issues can move from any status to Close)
fields.summary: Prevent workflow transition only in board

fields.description: Very often when you search for issues in the 'Linked issues' field on a word that clearly is in 1 or multiple issue titles, it doesn't find anything. Sometimes after refresh it does work, but of course that's very annoying.
fields.summary: Linked issues search not finding issues

fields.description:

h2.Summary 

Releases page fails to open correctly in IE 11 (version 11.0.9600.17631)

h2.Steps to Replicate

h2.Current result
The Release page is not displaying the data.

fields.description: When selecting an item on the Kanban page and viewing it in the preview panel I cannot open an attached file. I am directed to a new page and get an Error 404
fields.summary: Unable to open attached document on Kanban item preview panel

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create an Agile board with any number of sprints
# Request /rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/sprint

*bug* There is no "total" property in the response as documented here: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/cloud/#agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/sprint-getAllSprints

This bug prevents me Cloud add-on from making parallel requests for all Sprints as I cannot pre-determine how many pages there are.
fields.summary: JIRA Software Cloud Sprint REST API does not respond with "total" property as documented

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create an Agile board with at least one epic
# Request /rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/epic

*bug* There is no "total" property in the response as documented here: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/cloud/#agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/epic-getEpics

This bug prevents me Cloud add-on from making parallel requests for all epics as I cannot pre-determine how many pages there are.
fields.summary: JIRA Software Cloud Epic REST API does not respond with "total" property as documented

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create an Agile board associated to a project with more than 50 versions.
# Request /rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/version

*bug* There is no "total" property in the response as documented here: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/cloud/#agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/version-getAllVersions

This bug prevents me Cloud add-on from making parallel requests for all versions as I cannot pre-determine how many pages there are.
fields.summary: JIRA Software Cloud Version REST API does not respond with "total" property as documented

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13819].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# Create Kanban board
# Create Issue AAA
# Create subtask to this issue called BBB
# Using the Board, Move both parent and subtask to be the "In Progress" state
# drag parent issue, AAA, to Done column
# Click "Release..." to create a new release and clear the current done issues from this board
# Drag subtask BBB over to Done state

This creates a popup requesting you to update parent or cancel.

Expected result:
Clicking update should try to update the parent status and then finish

Actual result:
clicking update button only causes the popup to reappear again immediately.  This popup stays until you select cancel.

Workaround:
This only occurs when using the kanban board to drag this issue to this state.  If you edit the subtask to select the transition, this popup never occurs.


Note:
Since the parent issue is already resolved, I don't think this popup should be seen at all.  And if it is, then clicking the update button should complete that task and then close.
fields.summary: subtask popup to update parent issue caught in loop when parent issue close/removed from board

fields.description:
We have a single board with multiple project, and a single common sprint.

We'd like to use multiple Sprint Health Gadget with different filters, like :
 - per project filters...
 - per assignee filters...

As this gadget is the only one using issue points as a unit, we can't use issue statistics gadget instead.
fields.summary: Allow to set filters to the Sprint Health Gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers may have a setup where JIRA is being used across the globe. To optimize performance, they might want to setup caching proxies based on regions. Currently, it is not possible to set caching proxies per region due as there can only be one base URL, which will cause issues. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable JIRA to handle being configured to multiple caching proxies, each using their own domain.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to be able to set JIRA up with regional caching proxies

fields.description: Investigation showed that problem was caused by changed ActiveObjects implementation which started to cache lazy loaded values.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile WorkingDaysManager#update is returning invalidated objects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the [Burndown Chart|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Burndown+Chart], the Y-axis is configured as per board's Estimation Statistics. Consequently, when Time Tracking is set to 'Remaining Estimate and Time Spent', the Y-axis will indicates 'REMAINING TIME ESTIMATE' in hours. 

!Burndown_Chart.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great if this can be configured to days instead of hours.
fields.summary: Allow Y-Axis of Burndown Chart to be configurable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13810].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Issues removed from an active sprint (either into a next planned sprint or backlog) do not appear under "Issues Removed from Sprint" in the Sprint Report and the Burndown Chart does not show Scope Change

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.35.2 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Sprint in a JIRA Software Project
# Add Issues to the Sprint
# Start Sprint
# Move issues from the Active Sprint into either another Planned Sprint or the Backlog
# View Sprint Report or Burndown Chart

This is seen in instances with Parallel Sprints both enabled and disabled

h3. Expected Results
Both the Sprint Report and Burndown Chart should show Scope Change where these issues are being removed. 

h3. Actual Results
No errors in the logs
 
h3. Notes
If the Moved Issues are re-added, the Burndown Chart shows scope change; the Sprint Report shows the Issues as Incomplete. 

h3.Workaround
none
fields.summary: Issues removed from active sprint are no longer shown in the Sprint Report or Burndown Chart

fields.description:
The new section with application links shows custom application links as Incompatible. The applink works, but this 'Incompatible' marker puzzles and confuses our customers. Is there any way to show it correctly as for native applinks?
We develop TeamCity Integration for JIRA add-on, so this issue affects the initial user experience with the add-on.
fields.summary: Custom application links are displayed as Incompatible

fields.description:
We have several issues we use to log ongoing time to, and these issues now take up to a minute to load in the agile boards after selecting the issue and loading the "Issue Detail View". We determined this is because it gets "All Worklogs" and there are a several thousand worklogs.

When I searched, I found the following article, but when I go to Issue Detail View configuration, the Worklogs section seems to be a 'default' section that can't be removed...
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-the-issue-detail-view-764478043.html

There should be a way to remove whichever fields we deem necessary from the Issue Details view.
fields.summary: Need the abililty to remove worklogs from Issue Detail View on Agile Boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
Business type projects have a Summary tab clearly visible to access the Summary page (eg. http://localhost:8080/projects/PROA/summary)

Software type projects have the same summary page but they do not have a _Summary_ tab. To access this page, users must click on the name of the project. This is not clear and many users not know that it's a link.

h3. Suggestion
Give Software Projects the same _Summary_ tab so that it's easier for users to access the Summary page
fields.summary: Make Summary page more accessible for Software Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When JIRA Calendar gadget is based on a custom field (Date time type) with default date set as DD-MM-YYYY 12:00 am, then the data in the gadget does not show correctly.


h3. Environment
* Custom field of type 'Date Time Picker' with default value set at 12:00 am for example : '13/Jun/16 12:00 AM'
* JIRA Calendar gadget based in that custom field on the dashboard. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# With the above environment setup, create issues for the next day at 12:am for example : '14/Jun/16 12:00 AM'.
# Refresh the gadget on the dashboard

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should show the issue on the correct date.

h3. Actual Results
# The gadget now shows the issue on both dates : '13/Jun/16' as well as '14/Jun/16'
# Click on the number on the gadget, notice that the number on issue navigator is different than the number on the gadget.

 
h3. Notes
On Issue Navigator, notice that the query is : 
{{project = 10000 AND cf[10000] >= 2016-06-13 AND cf[10000] <= 2016-06-14}}

whereas, the query should be like 
{{project = 10000 AND cf[10000] >= 2016-06-13 AND cf[10000] < 2016-06-14}}

h3.Workaround
Changing the custom field default time to something other than 12:00 am should also work around this problem.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues calendar gadget not giving correct number of issues

fields.description:
If you link a Bitbucket repository to a project, create an issue, then commit some changesets against an issue, the changesets show up on the Development sidebar gadget.

This is working as expected, however, if you then delete the repository, the changesets remain against the JIRA issue and you end up with a bunch of 404 links to changesets that no longer exist.

Further, if you permanently delete the JIRA project (so the project KEY becomes available again), then open a new project with the same KEY, then start a new issue with the same code (eg. KEY-1), it seems any old changesets from the deleted repository will also show up against the new issue.

Since neither the original project or the original repository exist any more, this is clearly wrong and the association is misleading on the Issue (in some cases it might be totally confusing!)

I wasn't 100% sure whether to raise this against JIRA core or the DCVS connector... sorry about that!
fields.summary: JIRA issues can link to 404 changesets on deleted repositories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
This is related to performance problem described in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-13211. A JIRA system has a maximum throughput of JQL's depending on the number of cores etc, DB, index etc. Kanban boards have a "JQL load score" (_JQL complexity_) based on the complexity of the query and the multipliers created by swimlanes+colours.
A system can become overloaded if too many Kanban boards with a high "JQL load score" are loaded in a short interval.

h3. Suggested Solution
The system performance can be maintained if users that create boards are advised of their "JQL load score".

h3. Workaround 
Parse access log for slow requests and then review related Kanban boards
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to show to users JQL complexity of the Kanban boards

fields.description:
Hi 
i have an Ops project with 3 different ques in it (DevOps, Integration, Misc)
tasks are open for every Que and every Q have different amount of resources (man power) on it, basically every Q is a different team 

every task has an time estimation and due date and i want to find a way to be able to see that if a new task comes in to the Q i'm still able to make the due dates 

so to sum up i'm trying to find a way to cross match due dates and estimation for every Q and see that i don't have any problems

any way i can do this in Jira ?
fields.summary: resource mgmt for Ops tasks

fields.description:
When printing Cards in format Largest they do not render correctly when printing from a Windows environment. 

it does not matter if using Firefox, Chrome of IE. 

When printing from a Mac it works correctly. See screenshots to see difference.
fields.summary: Printing Cards does not render OK on Windows

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JSON File Example provided on JIRA 7 documentation is not compatible with JIRA 7.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Attempt to import a project using the JSON Source Example (_Project Key and Issue Key_) provided on [Importing data from JSON|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/importing-data-from-json-802592907.html#ImportingdatafromJSON-CreatingaJSONfileforImport] documentation 

{noformat}
{
    "projects": [
        {
            "name": "Sample data",
            "key": "SAM",
            "issues": [
                {
                    "key" : "SAM-123",
                    "status" : "Open",
                    "reporter" : "admin",
                    "summary" : "Parent case",
                    "externalId": "123"
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
To have the project created and imported properly.


h3. Actual Results
The project is not imported since it's missing the project type, giving the error below:

{noformat}
2016-06-10 15:08:07,044 INFO - ------------------------------
2016-06-10 15:08:07,044 INFO - Importing: Users
2016-06-10 15:08:07,044 INFO - ------------------------------
2016-06-10 15:08:07,044 INFO - Only new items will be imported
2016-06-10 15:08:07,044 INFO - 0 users associated with import. All of them imported as inactive, this can be changed after import in User Access step.
2016-06-10 15:08:07,044 INFO - ------------------------------
2016-06-10 15:08:07,044 INFO - Finished Importing : Users
2016-06-10 15:08:07,044 INFO - ------------------------------
2016-06-10 15:08:07,044 INFO - 0 users successfully created.
2016-06-10 15:08:07,044 INFO - Retrieving projects...
2016-06-10 15:08:07,045 ERROR - Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data may be in an unstable state
java.lang.Exception: Unable to import Project ExternalProject{id='null', key='SAM', externalName='null', name='Sample data'}
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importProject(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:648)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:357)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:15)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:538)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:501)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:254)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.external.ExternalException: Unable to create project: ExternalProject{id='null', key='SAM', externalName='null', name='Sample data'}
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.managers.CreateProjectManagerImpl.createProject(CreateProjectManagerImpl.java:95)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importProject(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:633)
	... 10 more
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: An invalid project type was specified. Unfortunately you can't create a project without a project type. Please talk to your JIRA administrator for help.
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.managers.CreateProjectManagerImpl.createProject(CreateProjectManagerImpl.java:82)
	... 11 more
2016-06-10 15:08:07,045 INFO - No issues need to be reindexed.
{noformat}



h3.Solution / Workaround

Include the project type as per JSON below:

{noformat}
{
    "projects": [
        {
            "name": "Sample data",
            "key": "SAM",
            "type": "software",
            "issues": [
                {
                    "key" : "SAM-123",
                    "status" : "Open",
                    "reporter" : "admin",
                    "summary" : "Parent case",
                    "externalId": "123"
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}
{noformat}
fields.summary: JSON File Example provided on JIRA 7 documentation is not compatible with JIRA 7.

fields.description: The very useful quick add is unfortunately not really usable because the issue type cannot be changed. The drop down next to the input field is at the very bottom of the browser window and opens up downwards instead of upwards so most of the options aren't clickable and run off the screen (s. screenshot).
fields.summary: Cannot select issue type in Quick add. Dropdown at the bottom opens out of screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the gadget will display all fields that can be applied regardless of relevance to the filter. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 We should allow the customer the ability to filter at the very least the fields that don't apply to the filter. We should at least make the Xaxis and Y axis searchable instead of just a list drop down. It's pretty cumbersome for instances that many fields that could apply with no way to filter them out.
fields.summary: Ability to filter out non relevant fields in the Two Dimensional filter gadget.

fields.description:
{panel}Original description by reporter -- Currently, if any issues in Sprint A in one board (Board A) got moved to Sprint B in another board (Board B), Sprint B will show up in the Velocity Report for Board A. 

It would be nice to limit sprints within a board in the Velocity Report. So no other sprints belonging to other boards should show up in the report. {panel}

h3. Summary

Velocity report include sprints from other boards. 

h3. Environment
* 2016-01-18 Cloud, 2016-02-01 Cloud, 1000.383.2 Cloud
* JIRA 7.x server

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Basically this might happen in the following scenario:
* You have Board A with filter "project = A". You have Sprint 1 with issue A-1, A-2 inside it. The Sprint 1 has to be a future Sprint otherwise it correctly shows up in the report.
* You have Board B with filter "project = B". You have Sprint 2 with issue B-1,B-2 inside it. The Sprint 2 has to be a future Sprint otherwise it correctly shows up in the report.

If issue A-1 is moved to Sprint B it means that Sprint B will contain 1 issue that match the filter of Board A, thus will make Sprint B APPEAR in board A. If that happen then the velocity report of board A will include Sprint B too. 

h3. Expected Results

Velocity Report should only show sprints from other boards if the issues were moved between active sprints, not in planning phase (between future sprints).
As moving issues to-from sprints affects velocity (committed/completed), the report should show it accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
* The chart include Sprint outside the scope of the board, and Sprint might result empty. 

!velocity.png|thumbnail!
 

h3.Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Velocity Report Should Only Show Sprints Related To The Current Board

fields.description:
On the window showing the integration of pull requests within BitBucket, when you have a reviewer that has marked a pull request as "Needs Work", the reviewer's icon is not marked with the appropriate badge.

The badge shows up for users who mark a pull request as "Approved".
fields.summary: Bit Bucket Integration Window does not show "Needs Work" badge for code reviewers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"+ Create issues" feature in scrum board backlog view is not working properly.
By creating a new issue using the scrum board backlog view, if you select the issue type, the issue type list will freeze and you won't be able to select it. Sometimes the issue type list moves around the screen.

!202839.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a scrum board.
# Open the board.
# Select backlog.
# Select *Create Issue*.
# Try to select the issue type dropdown button.

h3. Expected Results
You will select the issue type button and select one of the available issue types to create a new issue.

h3. Actual Results
You will select the issue type button and the issue type list will freeze, you wont be able to select one of the available issue types.

h3. Environment
Reproducible in Agile 1000.0.3 but working in Agile 1000.0.1
Tested in Safari and Chrome and had the same behavior in both browsers.
fields.summary: "+ Create issues" feature in scrum board backlog view is not working properly.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The user view an epic on a Kanban board, if he clicks on the epic to display 'Issue Detail View' then the issues linked on the epic aren't listed.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to add 'Issues in Epic' on 'Issue Detail View' 

h3. Workaround 
Open the epic in a separate screen
fields.summary: Add 'Issues in Epic' to 'Issue Detail View'

fields.description:
The date and time format used by JIRA is wrong and confusing.

When starting a Sprint in JIRA Agile, it prompts you to input date and time format as follows:

17/Jun/16 05:00 PM

International and well recognised standards are to use either:

1. 12 hour format: 17/Jun/16 5:00 PM
or 
2. 24 hour format: 17/Jun/16 17:00

The current approach is a blend of 12 and 24 hour format and incorrect.  In the example, above, when *05:00* is specified (using a leading zero) by definition this means 5:00 AM not PM.

Please could you correct your use of date and time formats to be consistent with international standards and common usage.
fields.summary: Correct Date and Time format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When accessing a JIRA Software Project, the default "Order By" is priority. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to configure a different 'Sort By' option within the Project configuration so that when the project is viewed the issues are sorted by a specific column. 

h3. Workaround
Manually select the sort by option that is most practical when viewing the issues using the Drop in the order by.
fields.summary: Make default 'Order By' option configurable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When running parallel sprints and completing an active sprint. You cannot move the issue to another active sprint without moving it to the backlog first. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the ability to move issues when ending a sprint to another active sprint with the scope change warning.
fields.summary: Cannot move open issues when ending an active sprint to another active sprint (Parallel sprints).

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a branch is created from a JIRA issue by clicking the "Create branch" link in the "Development" section, no information about this action is displayed on any of the "Activity" section tabs.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add an entry about the branch creation in the "Activity" tab.
fields.summary: Branch created from JIRA should be displayed in the "Activity" tab

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, as per [Printing issue cards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/printing-issue-cards-785332012.html] users can only print the issues card from the backlog and it is not possible to print the Epic and Version panel as well.


h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to print the Epic and Version panel on paper, in the same manner as JIRA Software does on the electronic board.
fields.summary: Ability to print Epic and Version panel on the Agile board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Kanban board cannot be viewed when Backlog feature for Kanban boards is enabled
h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JIRA Agile - 1000.0.3
* Chrome 51.0.2704.79

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Kanban Backlog in JIRA Software Labs
# View Kanban Board

h3. Expected Results
Board displayed
h3. Actual Results
# Board not displayed.
# No errors in logs
# Console shows _Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'key' of undefined_

h3.Workaround
Disable Backlog feature for Kanban boards will allow viewing the board
fields.summary: Kanban board cannot be viewed when Backlog feature for Kanban boards is enabled

fields.description: Please see the attched screenshots
fields.summary: Bug priority icon "Normal" is missing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Commits do not show in the Development Panel if the Issue Key is mentioned more than once in a commit message

h3. Environment
* Development Integration Plugin 3.3.25
* FishEye 3.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Assuming the issue key is KEY-123
# Commit in the repository with a message such as: "KEY-123 - KEY-123 code changes"
# In FishEye, the commit will be listed normally
# In JIRA, the development panel in the view issue page will not show this particular commit

h3. Expected Results
The commit should be listed in development panel even if the issue key is mentioned twice in the message

h3. Actual Results
The commit is not listed in the development panel

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Commits do not show in the Development Panel if the Issue Key is mentioned more than once in a commit message

fields.description:
Hi,
Is it possible to do a Sprint Burndown chart that is based on tasks rather than story points ?  And specifically hours on those task's original estimates rather than Story Points for the parent Story ?
Regards
Michael
fields.summary: Sprint Burn-Down by Hours instead of by Story Points

fields.description: We have a project with multiple teams each working on a different application.So there are nearly 20 to 25 versions planned in the project. It would be great if we could filter the versions by a field(team field) and could see only the versions related to the team on the left hand versions tab of the backlog screen.
fields.summary: Filtering the versions on the left hand tab of the backlog screen

fields.description: As Portfolio Live Plans user I want to see cross-project releases (CPR) in the linked agile board's version sidebar so that I can use the agile board to look at details and schedule work related to a particular CPR without having to create a quick filter for every CPR in my plan.
fields.summary: As Portfolio Live Plans user I want to see cross-project releases in Agile boards' version sidebar

fields.description:
Similar to JSW-5720 I'd like to see an option to create swim-lanes based on component.

The current method we use is to use the query filter and create a swimlane for each component.

Having this done automatically  would reduce the effort to initially configure kanban boards and future proof them in the event new components are added to the system.

The difficulty in implementing this is that an issue may belong to multiple components, and this  may render the board difficult to read. If you decide to watch this issue please post any suggestions on how this may be best visualized.
fields.summary: Add a new swimlane based on components for Kanban boards to reduce effort to setup and maintain boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

AV software is complaining about HTML Exploit in JIRA Software project

h3. Environment

Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Clam XAV
# Open ticket in JIRA


h3. Expected Results

Ticket should open without error

h3. Actual Results

Ticket opens
AV software complains about HTML Exploit on page

!exploiterror.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: HTML Exploit error in AV software when viewing JIRA tickets

fields.description:
Since JIRA 7.1.x comment boxes are to narrow

Steps to reproduce:
# Open an agile board
# select an issue
# press "m" to open a comment overlay

See attached screenshots
fields.summary: Comment overlay box to narrow since 7.1.x

fields.description:
When generating a version report within JIRA Agile 6.7.2 (and at least 6.7.12), within environments with large datasets, the version report chart does not correctly estimate completion dates.  In this case all three of those dates (optimistic, normal, and pessimistic) estimates can end up being listed on the same day.  Furthermore, these dates seem to be cutoff on the far right, instead of reaching the y-axis

It seems that the algorithm which prepares the series of data for predictions on chart does not take into account that there might be non-working days.

 !versionreportbad.png|thumbnail! 



Workaround:

* Click "Board" in top right corner
* Click "Configure" in drop-down menu
* Navigate to "Working Days" in the menu on the left
* Select all days as working.
* Navigate back to report

With work-around enabled, now report shows proper dates for predictions.

 !versionreportgood.png|thumbnail! 

This happens because predictions was made with non-working dates taken into account, but algorithm which generates series for chart does not take non-working days into account so it finishes chart earlier.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile version report does not correctly take into account non-working days

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to read Card Layouts via the JIRA Software REST API.

Being able to read the Card Layout from JIRA Software would more closely align Add-on Easy Agile User Story Maps with the JIRA Software layout users are used to.

We cannot currently retrieve the card layouts in JIRA Cloud as they are not available via the JIRA Software REST API
fields.summary: Expose Card Layout in the JIRA Software API

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to create, read, update or delete Quick Filters via the JIRA Software REST API. 

This feature is required for us to solve our top-requested feature for Easy Agile User Story Maps. 

We cannot currently retrieve the Quick Filters in JIRA Cloud as they are not available via the JIRA Software REST API.
fields.summary: Expose Quick Filters in JIRA Software API

fields.description:
Similar to JSW-6651...

An issue was transitioned from To Do, to In Progress, to In Review, and back to To Do, just now, because it is blocked.

The "Days in Column" shows 51 days even though it was just transitioned moments ago.

Perhaps the calculation is being counted from the time the ticket first went into the To Do column (likely when it was created) vs. time since it's last update to this column?
fields.summary: Agile board shows Days in Column incorrectly for issue transitioned back to To Do

fields.description:
Current documentation screenshot implies that there is an option for filters to be shared with all users:

[Managing shared filters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Managing+shared+filters]

This bug has been fixed: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29503 

Thus, the screenshot needs to be changed to: Shared with everyone.
fields.summary: Change screenshot in the documentation for shared filters

fields.description: As of JIRA v6.4.12, autocompletion for the Epic field will suggest epic names from all projects. When considering a substantial number of projects with dozens of epics, their names names often collide and make it hard to select the correct one from the drop down. Ideally only the current project epics would be offered to the user by default, as 99% of the times it's those he's after.
fields.summary: Epic field autocompletion in issue creation screen should suggest only current project's epics

fields.description: Failure
fields.summary: Test

fields.description:
I am doing the JIRA tutorial for Atlassian Devlopers and I have installed the SDK from this location: 
https://developer.atlassian.com/docs/getting-started/set-up-the-atlassian-plugin-sdk-and-build-a-project/install-the-atlassian-sdk-on-a-windows-system

On the next lesson, on step 3, I run the command to start JIRA: atlas-run-standalone --product jira

When the command completes successfully, I log into http://localhost:2990/jira and using admin/admin as username and password, I can successfully get into the dashboard.  When I click on the cog wheel and choose Add-ons, I get to the "Manage add-ons" screen.  At this point I get an error message:  *This version of JIRA is unrecognized by the Atlassian Marketplace. It might be a non-standard build or be too new to appear.*

I am trying to get to the hello world plugin tutorial part, but I get this error message.  I have researched similar tickets about the same issue and they all say this has been resolved.  It is still producing the error message even when I change the version in the pom.xml.

Our company is considering buying your product and I am looking at the ease of the development piece.  Please let me know how to fix this so I can proceed.
fields.summary: Install of SDK-Manage Add-On Error Message: This version of JIRA is unrecognized by the Atlassian Marketplace. It might be a non-standard build or be too new to appear.

fields.description:
* When looking at a single Task, in the "Sub-Tasks" list, show the Task "Key" between the Status and Description. The same as it appears in the "Issues in Epic" list.
 
* When looking at a single Task, in the "Sub-Tasks" and "Issues in Epic" lists, show the "Fix Version/s" after the "Assignee".
fields.summary: Show Task Key and Fix Version in "Sub-Tasks" and "Issues in Epic" lists

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When running the Sprint Report, the active sprint is not displayed as the default one and instead it's showing a closed sprint report by default.

On the Burnout report, the active sprint is displayed properly as the default one. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new board;
# Create a sprint (Sprint 1) and add issues to it;
# Close the sprint (Sprint 1);
# Create a new sprint (Sprint 2) and add issues to it;
# Go to reports and select Sprint Report.

h3. Expected Results
* To have the Sprint Report displayed for Sprint 2 by default.


h3. Actual Results
* The Sprint Report displays the Sprint 1 as the default one instead Sprint 2.


h3. Notes
* The same issue is not replicable when using JIRA Software 7.0.5 or 7.0.10;


h3.Solution / Workaround
* Manually select the active sprint on the dropdown menu.
fields.summary: Sprint Report is not showing the active sprint as the default one

fields.description:
Hi,

After renaming an Epic, the new name of the epic is not used for links.

Cheers Megan
fields.summary: Epic link selection uses original epic name.

fields.description:
Currently, the date/time presentation must be configured in the Look and Feel page of the Admin portal, but the Javascript based date/time picker must be configured via properties in the Advanced Configuration section.

Please unify this configuration in a clean way in the Look and Feel page.
fields.summary: Configuration of date time picker should be unified in admin portal

fields.description:
We have sprints with lots of issues and all of them have multiple subtasks. I have the healthy habit of collapsing all issues that are completely done, to keep an uncluttered overview of the work still to do. JIRA will remember which issues are closed and which are not. So far, so good.

Now something changes in the order of the sprint, like moving an issue up in de order or adding a new issue at the top of the sprint. I know this is not supposed to happen in Scrum during a sprint, but of course it will from time to time. The collapsed / uncollapsed view is now messed up: some previously collapsed issues are now uncollapsed and vice-versa. Of course this is annoying, because I expect all collapsed issues to be done.

I'm a developer myself and did some research to help find & fix the problem. I found that the localStorage entry gh.boardSettings.x has a collapsedSwimLanes property which is an array of numbers. I assume these are issue indices referring to the n'th issue at the sprint board. This would explain why the view gets messed up when you add issues somewhere else than at the bottom of the sprint cause the indices of all 'lower' issues will change.

My suggested solution is to use issue numbers, like JOC-142 instead of indices as entries in the collapsedSwimLanes array. These are unique per JIRA instance and not depending on any order.

Thanks for considering this fix and making an already happy JIRA user even more happy! :)

P.S. I also see numbers higher than the amount of issues on my current sprint, so it seems these are not reset when a new sprint opens and also not during the sprint. When using issue numbers, maybe this should not happen anymore and the whole list should be refreshed every time a change occurs.
fields.summary: Collapsed swim lanes can't handle Sprint issue reordering

fields.description: New information that can be added to the KB article.  More in the private comment.
fields.summary: Modify the JMWE removal from JIRA Cloud KB article

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13701].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
_View on board_ call (GHGoToBoard.jspa) loads all Board's JQL and executes them one by one to check if given issue belongs to it. So by design _View on board_ performance will degrade with increasing number of boards. This also multiplied by complexity of each Board's JQL. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Jira with many issues (> 500k)
# Create many board (> 1000)
# Go to _View on board_ link at any issue.  

h3. Expected Results
Call executed with-in 1 minute. It's JScript timeout. 

h3. Actual Results
Call timeouts with *Communications breakdown* error. If you open link in new time it might take 200 secs. 
 
h3. Notes
None

h3.Workaround
# h5. Reduce number of boards
#* Check *scrum boards*. Check the sprint dates for the current/last sprint. If a project is inactive then it is highly likely that sprints have not been planned in the recent few months.
#* Check *kanban board*. Run the created/resolved chart for the filter/project in that kanban board and see. Again, if the project is inactive then not many new issues would had been created in recent past.
#* Check  *empty JQL board*.
fields.summary: JIRA "View on Board" link GHGoToBoard response time degrades with number of boards
